entry.title: U.S. Strikes Give Yemen's Houthis the Enemy They Long Sought
entry.content: A religiously inspired militia that emerged from Yemen’s northern mountains 20 years ago is now more powerful than ever.

entry.title: South Africans Rally Around Government's Case Against Israel
entry.content: South Africans this week rallied around their government’s decision to take Israel to the International Court of Justice, with many saying they were motivated by their own country’s struggle against apartheid.

entry.title: Israel Plans Risky Mission to Seize Last Gaza Border it Doesn't Control
entry.content: A military operation along Gaza’s southern border would be tricky, with Egypt on one side and a million displaced Palestinians concentrated on the other.

entry.title: A Crusade to Help the Homeless, One Old Bike at a Time
entry.content: A street minister, working with volunteer mechanics, has provided about 1,000 rebuilt bicycles to unhoused people and others in South Dakota who have no other way to get to their jobs.
